issue.message: Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in variable 'calculateSize' with type Function1<? super IntSize, ? extends IntSize>.

Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in variable 'calculateOffset' with type Function2<? super PlacementScope, ? super IntermediateMeasureScope, ? extends IntOffset>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in variable 'onOptionSelected' with type Function1<? super Integer, ? extends Unit>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in method TransitionOptions has parameter 'onOptionSelected' with type Function1<? super Integer, Unit>.
